description.narrative: Project aimed at strengthening the capacities and capabilities of national stakeholders to manage PCBs as well as their destruction, as identified as a priority in the National Implementation Plan for Persistent Organic Pollutants for Ethiopia

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.Approved project document on PCB management 2.National PCB management plan is drafted and approved 3.National PCB tracking system developed and operational 4.Number of technical and procedural guidance documents compliant with Stockholm Convention and national regulations completed and endorsed 5.Number of operators/technical staff in the electric sector and in MEFCC trained on and confident in practically applying the ESM system for PCBs No of trainees will be 80 6.Number of Gender dimension study in the context of PCB issues in Ethiopia completed and strategies for better gender mainstreaming in POPs-related activities identified

comment.narrative: 1.There is no Project document that indicates PCB Management 2.No national PCB management plan developed or available to guide action on addressing PCB matters in the country 3.Central consolidated PCB database to track inventory and PCB disposal process is not available 4.No or insufficient technical level guidance materials exist on ESM for PCB management 5.No training on ESM of PCBs issued delivered to operators/technical staff in the electric sector countrywide Central consolidated PCB database to track inventory and PCB disposal process is not available 6.No gender dimension study carried out on POPs in Ethiopia

1. One Inception activities will be carried out, on project management structure implemented 2.One National PCB management plan is drafted and approved 3.National PCB data base drafted 4.Guidance drafted for sampling of online and offline equipment, identification and labeling procedures, handling, transportation, temporary storage, and disposal will be developed and discussed at workshops 5.Using the guidance material, a training sessions covering 80 operators/technical staff of the electric sector implemented 6.compliance with UN policies on equal opportunities, GEF Policy on Gender Mainstreaming, and UNDP Gender Equality Strategy (2014-2017) will be maintained at each Stage and training will be given on this issue

1. Project inception workshop held for different stakeholders; PMU and Project Steering Committee have been established and Project Steering Committee meeting held 2. Training Workshop for the preparation of PCB Chemical Management Plan conducted and PCB Management plan framework document prepared. 3. Training on PCB and chemical Database preparation conducted 4. Procurement for PCB inventory equipment, and IT is floated for bidders 5. Will be done after the procurement of PCB inventory equipment 6. Gender dimension study completed

1. Comprehensive assessment of the national legal and institutional framework completed 2. New or amended legislation and regulations which includes specific PCB provisions adopted and disseminated to key national stakeholders 3. Technical assistance to the environmental authorities on the enforcement of the new or amended legislation and technical regulations related to PCBs delivered through specialized trainings and joint participation of project staff and government representatives 4. Guidance drafted for sampling of online and offline equipment, operation and maintenance of PCB-contaminated equipment, identification and labeling procedures, handling, transportation, temporary storage, and disposal discussed in 5 dedicated workshops 5. Using the guidance material, at least 5 training sessions covering 80 operators/technical staff of the electric sector implemented 6. Analysis equipment is procured as per the procurement request and PPE equipment for personnel is available to ensure safe operations 7. Sampling and analysis of 10,000 pieces of PCB-suspected equipment carried out, if applicable 8. Two PSC meeting held 9. An awareness raising strategy developed, and awareness materials for different target groups, developed and disseminated 10. project website established 11. Dissemination of project objectives and midterm results through establishment of a website, and workshops, and enhancement of gender related issues 12. Midterm evaluation and auditing activities carried out

1. The project has achieved its milestone activities by having the inventory data of all transformers with necessary information in the country. This is the foundation of the major project activities, thus it is great achievement. 2. Project Steering Committee (PSC) has been established and the PSC has conducted first, second and third meetings. 3. The project overarching guiding plan “National Management Plan for Polychlorinated Biphenyls (PCBs), 2019-2022” is prepared up on conducting training. 4. Procurement of sampling and analysis of PCB kits and equipment is finalized. Winner of the bid is identified, offer is given and now it is on the final delivery arrangement. This is also a major milestone activity in having the subsequent tasks to get done. 5. Ethiopia has proclaimed Proclamation entitled “Industrial Chemical Registration and Administration Proclamation” No. 1075/2018. However, Ethiopia has no national system for registration and administration of chemicals. With the assistance of the project “Establishment of key elements of national systems for sound chemicals management in selected countries in Eastern Europe, Caucasus and Central Asia (Belarus, Georgia and Kazakhstan). The project has established chemical data base software. The software has helped the responsible institutions to customize the software and establishment chemicals registry. It enabled any person who is producing, importing, exporting, distributing, storing, or using industrial chemicals to have online record keeping and reporting which has huge benefit in terms of time, cost and avoiding litigation by the law enforcing body. 6. To make the software functional, four back to back workshops were conducted:- Endorsement and launching ceremony was held in the presence of Ministries and Commissioners; Technical Team Training (3 day training); Two days Training workshop was given for experts drawn from Companies which produce and/or import chemical Media briefing and orientations was given to chemical factory managers on the commencement of chemical registration and associated responsibility (1 day event) 7. Similarly, PCB management database was also developed; the data base will be used for the inventory of transformers, keeps record of transformers with PCB chemical and the status in which the transformer is located. 8. Theoretical and practical Training of trainers (TOT) was given by UNITAR (via zoom) on PCB chemical screening and analysis 9. Thereafter three separate training was given to all experts (Technician from EEU, EEP and Ethio-Engineering Group, EFCCC and Regional experts) who will conduct the PCB transformers screening and analysis  Legal frame work on PCB management (in English) prepared  Communication and awareness raising strategy on PCB chemical and other hazardous chemical prepared  An awareness raising on PCB and other chemicals was given to regions and other stakeholders  Awareness creation on PCB and other hazardous chemicals given to women  training was given on Stockholm Convention, facility level PCB Management Plan, Occupational Health, Safety and Emergency Response 10. Contractual agreement for laboratory service signed, budget dispersed and training was given on Gas Chromatography as way of reinforce the national analytical capacity to support PCB management in Ethiopia. 12. Tender process is underway to procure laboratory chemicals reagents for PCB analysis to be used by laboratory service i.e Ethiopia Conformity Assessment Enterprise 13. First training was given on TOT approach and thereafter training was given to all experts who will conduct the screening  PCB suspected transformers were mapped according to Regional distribution  Analysis and identification of transformers having PCB was conducted  478 transformers were examined out of 252 samples were collected.  PCB data complied using the database sheet  Second phase Procurement of materials and Goods (PPE and1000 PCB test kits) in the process  Document on Chemical response procedures and mechanisms prepared  The Directive on PCB translated in to Amharic 14. But the COVID pandemic has exerted challenges to move forward, to mitigate this; the project team has designed COVID 19 Related Risk of Implementation and Possible Mitigation Measures and implemented it accordingly.  More importantly, the project performance is hampered by the unavailability of the transport vehicles; the project team has tried to mitigate the problem by securing one vehicle from EFCCC and given the number of car, the project team has made good stride in conducting the inventory of PCB transforms.  Training was given on • Stockholm Convention, • Occupational Health, Safety and Emergency Response to all relevant stakeholders.  As a result, document on Chemical response procedures and mechanisms prepared.  Training on the preparation of Facility-level PCB management plans was given. Subsequently, Ethiopian Electric Utility (EEU) PCB Management Plan Prepared  In sum, evaluating the project performance against the objectives and outcomes to be achieved at the end of project targets is satisfactory.

1. Conduct national preliminary inventory on all suspect PCB containing equipment 2. Reinforce the national analytical capacity (ECAE) to support the updating and completion of the PCB inventory through providing 3. Procure laboratory equipment for PCB analysis to be used by ECAE 4. Conduct PCB transformer analysis using Gas Chromatography and identify level of PCB concentration 5. Identify contaminated sites and develop management plans for at least 10 sites 6. Provide customized training on PCB management such as: operation and maintenance of PCB-contaminated equipment; handling including risk reduction approaches; transportation; temporary storage; and elimination 7. Give training on criteria for design requirements and temporary storage facility management best practices, Maintenance of PCB-contaminated equipment and handling 8. Identify and upgrade Storage facilities for the temporary storage of PCB-contaminated equipment 9. Drafting of TORs for the procurement of ESIA and monitor and review the ESIA report

1. The result under this target is- the project has obtained 32255 transformers owned by Ethiopia Electric Utility (EEU) across the country. And among these 5321 transformers were found to be suspected of PCB. Based on this training was given on how to conduct inventory of suspected PCB containing transformers. The project team deployed inventory teams to different regions, subsequently the teams have examined 2937 transformers on site and 1243 samples were collected for further analysis. Similarly, training was given to Ethiopia Electric Power (EEP) staffs on PCB transformers inventory and the inventory team examined 148 transformers from power generation and substations and 148 samples were collected for further analysis. 2. Contractual agreement for laboratory service signed, budget dispersed and training was given on Gas Chromatography as way of reinforce the national analytical capacity to support PCB management in Ethiopia. 3. Tender process is underway to procure laboratory chemicals reagents for PCB analysis to be used by laboratory service i.e Ethiopia Conformity Assessment Enterprise. The bid is technical evaluation stage and the winner in terms of technical aspect is identified. 4. The target under this only achieved up on the delivery of the laboratory chemicals reagents for PCB analysis. Thus, will achieved next to the finalization of the bid process and delivered by the potential supplier. 5. In collaboration with UNITAR training on sustainable management of PCB contaminated sites was given and based on the training draft Preliminary Site Assessment for Kotebe Workshop and Dumping Site of Power Transformer was prepared 6. Training on the PCB Management, Handling, Transport, Storage and Elimination Strategy was given by UNITAR. 7. in a similar vein, in collaboration with UNITAR training on the PCB Management, Handling, Transportation, Storage facility management and Elimination Strategy was given. 8. Consultation with the CEOs of the EU, EEP was made to secure storage facility, however, no specific area was obtained thus far. And a team of experts will be formed to make country wide assessment and identify possible areas. 9. Result as it is pointed out in the above, no specific storage facility was obtained, for this reason target 9 is not achieved.

1. New legal framework for PCB in place, give training and enforced. 2. Technical assistance to the environmental authorities on the enforcement of the new or amended legislation and technical regulations related to PCBs delivered through specialized trainings and joint participation of project staff and government representatives 3. National PCB data base developed and internationalized 4. Package of PCB analysis equipment procured 5. Storage facilities for the temporary storage of PCB-contaminated equipment are identified 6. EIA process regarding decontamination plants carried out to enable technology to operate locally, if applicable 7. Documentary and direct evidence that environmentally sound technologies or services for PCBs disposal/dechlorination have been identified, assessed, and procured 8. Amount of equipment or waste containing or contaminated by PCB disposed in an environmentally sound manner 9. knowledge management system including project website
